p.The Humanities and Cultural Studies mino: The Humanities and Cultural Studies minor is a rigorous study of the artistic and intellectual practices and products of human culture in the contemporary world and in the past, across world cultures.

courseSection0.text:
The Humanities and Cultural Studies minor is a rigorous study of the artistic and intellectual practices and products of human culture in the contemporary world and in the past, across world cultures.
Minor Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
HUM2020 - Encountering the Humanities (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Humanities Foundations 
HUM3252 - Contemporary Humanities (3)
HUM3255 - Modern Humanities (3)
HUM3431 - Ancient Humanities (3)
HUM3435 - Medieval Humanities (3)
courseSection0.text2:
Theories and Methods
HUM3326 - Theories of Sex and Gender in Humanities (3)
HUM3800 - Research Methods in Humanities (3)
HUM3805 - Critical Theory in the Humanities (3)
HUM3806 - Critical Race Theory (3)
HUM3830 - Introduction to Digital Humanities (3)
HUM4330 - Performance Theory (3)
HUM4823 - Queer Theory in the Humanities (3)
HUM4826 - Postcolonial Theory (3)
courseSection0.text3:
Cultural Traditions
HUM3401 - Asian Humanities (3)
HUM3423 - African Humanities (3)
HUM3460 - Latin American Humanities (3)
HUM4459 - American Cultural Studies in Humanities (3)
courseSection0.text4:
Topics in Cultural Studies
HUM4931 - Key Figures in the Humanities & Cultural Studies (3)
HUM4934 - Key Concepts in Humanities & Cultural Studies (3)

li.A \"C\" (2.0) grade or better is require: A "C" (2.0) grade or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Other Requirements

A "C" (2.0) grade or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.
